Package com.xm.cryptorecservice.persistence

Class InMemoryAggregateStats

java.lang.Object
com.xm.cryptorecservice.persistence.InMemoryAggregateStats
@Component public class InMemoryAggregateStats extends Object
An in-memory " database " of crypto stats with thread-safe structural modification operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • InMemoryAggregateStats

      public InMemoryAggregateStats()

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(String crypto, CryptoPriceStats stats)
      Add the pair < crypto, stats > to the in-memory DB.
      Parameters:
      crypto - The name of the cryptocurrency. It uniquely identifies the cryptocurrency in the in-memory DB.
      stats - An instance of CryptoPriceStats to associate the cryptocurrency with.

    • get

      public CryptoPriceStats get(String crypto)
      Retrieve the aggregate stats associated with the provided crypto.
      Parameters:
      crypto - The unique crypto name to return the aggregate stats of.
      Returns:
      An instance of CryptoPriceStats corresponding to the provided crypto, or null if the crypto is not in the DB.

    • containsCrypto

      public boolean containsCrypto(String crypto)
      Queries the in-memory DB for existence of a particular cryptocurrency name.
      Parameters:
      crypto - The crypto name to search for.
      Returns:
      true if the crypto is in our database, false otherwise.

    • printAllStats

      public void printAllStats()
      A method that prints all the available states to stdout, useful mostly for debugging. Is not thread-safe, but also does not structurally modify this in any way.

    • copyOfStats

      public Map<String,CryptoPriceStats> copyOfStats()
      Performs a shallow copy of the statistics held by this. Not thread-safe, but also not structurally modifying the store in any way.
      Returns:
      A SortedMap containing the crypto names of the in-memory DB as keys and the relevant aggregate stats as values. It is sorted by lexicographical order of keys, ascending.

    • cryptosSortedByNormalizedPriceDescending

      public SortedMap<String,BigDecimal> cryptosSortedByNormalizedPriceDescending(SortOrder sortOrder)
      Returns the cryptocurrencies we support in ascending or descending order of normalized price. Not thread safe, but also not modifying the store in any way.
      Parameters:
      sortOrder - A SortOrder instance that determines if we want ascending or descending sort order.
      Returns:
      A SortedMap whose keys are sorted by value, in ascending or descending order.

    • getSupportedCryptos

      public Set<String> getSupportedCryptos()
      Return the cryptocurrencies that the application supports.
      Returns:
      A Set with all the supported cryptocurrency names.
